training_data.instruction: Tell me about Admission and Program Requirements - Computer Science Major - Computer Science Department.
training_data.response:
Admission and Program Requirements
Major in computer science
Here are the steps and requirements you need to complete for the computer science major.
Your first steps: Declare your major
- Become a Bear: Apply to Missouri State. (If you’re not already a current student.)
- Before completing 60 credit hours, contact the Academic Advising and Transfer Center
to
[declare or change your major](https://www.MissouriState.edu/Advising/steps-to-declare-or-change-a-major.htm)to computer science.
After you declare: Complete the program requirements
Complete these requirements to earn a bachelor's degree in computer science.
Computer Science (Non-Comprehensive) (BS)
Major Requirements
Major Core (43 hours):
[CSC 130 - The World of Computer Science](https://catalog.missouristate.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=14&coid=48185)[CSC 131 - Computational Thinking](https://catalog.missouristate.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=14&coid=48188)[CSC 232 - Data Structures](https://catalog.missouristate.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=14&coid=48190)[CSC 244 - Computer Architecture](https://catalog.missouristate.edu/preview_course_nopop.

metadata.topic: Admission and Program Requirements - Computer Science Major - Computer Science Department

training_data.instruction: Give me comprehensive information about Admission and Program Requirements - Computer Science Major - Computer Science Department.
training_data.response:
Admission and Program Requirements
Major in computer science
Here are the steps and requirements you need to complete for the computer science major.
Your first steps: Declare your major
- Become a Bear: Apply to Missouri State. (If you’re not already a current student.)
- Before completing 60 credit hours, contact the Academic Advising and Transfer Center
to
[declare or change your major](https://www.MissouriState.edu/Advising/steps-to-declare-or-change-a-major.htm)to computer science.
After you declare: Complete the program requirements
Complete these requirements to earn a bachelor's degree in computer science.
Computer Science (Non-Comprehensive) (BS)
Major Requirements
Major Core (43 hours):
[CSC 130 - The World of Computer Science](https://catalog.missouristate.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=14&coid=48185)[CSC 131 - Computational Thinking](https://catalog.missouristate.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=14&coid=48188)[CSC 232 - Data Structures](https://catalog.missouristate.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=14&coid=48190)[CSC 244 - Computer Architecture](https://catalog.missouristate.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=14&coid=48191)[CSC 335 - Database System Concepts](https://catalog.missouristate.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=14&coid=48194)[CSC 360 - Operating Systems](https://catalog.missouristate.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=14&coid=48196)[CSC 365 - Internet Programming](https://catalog.missouristate.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=14&coid=48197)[CSC 388 - Introduction to Secure Computing](https://catalog.missouristate.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=14&coid=48175)[CSC 450 - Introduction to Software Engineering](https://catalog.missouristate.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=14&coid=48176)[CSC 482 - Seminar in Computer Science](https://catalog.missouristate.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=14&coid=48201)[CSC 565 - Computer Networks](https://catalog.missouristate.edu/preview_course_nopop.php?catoid=14&coid=48207)
Public Affairs Capstone Experience will be fulfilled by completion of:
Successful Completion of the Computer Science Major Field Test (MFT)
with at least a score of 145 for Computer Science/Computer Science option and 140 for Computer Science/Software Development option is required.
